content.description: Start as for Wright Bros., but instead of heading right, just campus to the top in a single beefy pull-up.
content.location: It is in the middle of Lower Skyport.

content.description: Start on two crimps. Use the foot down right to make some balancey moves to the rail, then use the crimps above to get to the mantle.
content.location: It is in the middle of Lower Skyport.

content.description: Start in the seam underneath the roof to the left of Moonflight. I'll put a picture of the start on this page, and there is a beta video in the comments. Make 2 moves into the start of Moonflight, and climb then it normally.There might be some more options for the feet to the left, but the moss needs to be cleaned first.The crux is not dabbing.
content.location: It is to the left of Moonflight.

content.description: Crouch start with a positive crimp rail and bomber feet. Work your hips to make it to the top.
content.location: It is on the right-most side of Lower Skyport.

content.description:
Sit start on the left-most rail in the middle of the scoop. Traverse right into Liftoff, then fire up to the top. v6-7 depending on your height. 

  Was first done at 3am, with a bright moon lighting the way.
content.protection: One crash pad to be safe, two to be comfortable.
content.location: Middle of the scoop on Lower Skyport

content.description: Sit-start on a big jug/ledge. Make a big move to a good crimp, match the rail, then get to the top for a slightly tricky topout. V3-4 depending on your height.

This is an eliminate of Barrel Roll that avoids the first hold (the big, slopey jug out left). 

  Start in the slopey pocket, then become one with friction as you bump up the sloping rail. Keep moving up until you can finally latch on to the jug ledge. There is an easy topout from here.
content.location: It is on the left-most side of Lower Skyport.

content.description:
Earhart is an extension to Wright Bros.

  Start on the long rail. Find a way into Wright Bros., then finish it up.
content.location: It is in the middle of Lower Skyport.

content.description: Start with both hands in the slopey pocket. Find the right feet to power up to the ledge out left. Adjust and fire to the jug ledge out right. It is an easy topout from here.

Armstrong is an extension to Earhart. 

  Start as for Barrel Roll, but avoid the lip at the top. Instead traverse right, figuring out a way to get your left hand to the pinch at the top of the sloping rail that makes up the right side of Barrel Roll. Continue right into Earhart, then finish up with Wright Bros.

  A project extends even further and continues from Wright Bros. all the way into the mantle for Liftoff.
content.protection: Use two crash pads to be safe, three to be comfortable.
content.location: It is in the middle of Lower Skyport.

content.description: Areophobia is an extension to Liftoff. Start as for Liftoff, but instead of topping out directly, at the jug, trend left to the sloper, figure out a way over to the finishing jugs of Wright Bros., and top out. Linking Moonflight or Saturn into this would be cool to do. The grades don’t make sense to me, so if you do it and it’s easier/harder, feel free to weight in.
content.location: It is on the right side of the boulder on the obvious jug.

content.description: This is the bottom block of Skyport and the furthest boulder in Neverland . . which is to say it's about 2-3 minutes from the parking lot ;)Pro-tip: on each visit, scoop one handful of dirt/duff off the top of Lower Skyport. This will help the place dry after rain, and make for better mantels.
